events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred at a busy intersection with minor damages to the rear bumper.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to the involvement of a vehicle collision on public roads.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to the customer case to ensure prompt processing and clear communication.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and confirmed the next steps to the policyholder.
Customer was requested to submit the accident report, photos of damages, and a police report to proceed with investigation.
The customer provided all requested documents including detailed photos and the official accident report from the police.
The claims investigation team initiated assessment of the damages and gathered necessary information from involved parties.
Investigators concluded the assessment confirming the extent of vehicular damage and liability as reported in the claim.
A proposed settlement amount was communicated to the customer reflecting repairs costs and policy coverage limits.
The customer expressed concerns about the proposed settlement not fully covering all repair expenses incurred.
Due to the dispute over settlement figures, the claim was escalated to senior management for further review.
After reconsideration, the claim approval included a revised settlement amount ensuring adequate coverage of damages.
The settlement payment was successfully issued to the customerâ€™s account for authorized vehicle repairs.
The claim was formally closed following confirmation of payment receipt and customer satisfaction with resolution.
